sentences.sentence: In Kyiv, a seven-year-old girl was rescued from a building that was struck by a missile, according to Ukrainian authorities.

sentences.sentence: Missiles in Kiev have struck at least two residential buildings and the first Russian airstrike on the city since June 5th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In total, 14 missiles targeted the city on Sunday morning, according to Ukrainian authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And he added that he believed the strikes were meant to intimidate Ukrainians ahead of the next NATO summit. The alliance is planning to meet from June 28th to the 30th in Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The strikes also came a day after the city imposed a new curfew, limiting people's movement from 11pm to 5am.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The last airstrike on the Ukrainian capital targeted a factory, leaving one person injured.

sentences.sentence: The leaders of the world's seven richest democracies have begun discussions on how they can better support Ukraine whilst ratcheting up the pressure on Russia.

sentences.sentence: It's greatly complicated by the dangerous rise in global energy prices, which could yet trigger a global recession, and the rise in global food prices, which could see famines break out.

sentences.sentence: The EU's Commission president tweeted her unwavering support for Ukraine. Although it's not strictly a G7 member, the EU is a guest at the talks.

sentences.sentence: We will stand with Ukraine for as long as it takes.

sentences.sentence: The negative global impact of Russia's war will be front and centre of our exchanges at the G7.

sentences.sentence: And the UK leader Boris Johnson said now's not the time to give up on Ukraine.

sentences.sentence: The EU's foreign policy chief, Joseph Borrere says talks between the US and Iran will resume in the coming days after flying to Iran for talks with foreign minister Hossein Amir Abdullahiyan. Negotiations between the nuclear powers stalled as Iran proceeded to produce uranium closer than ever to weapon grade levels. Mr. Amir Abdullahiyan spoke about why a resolution would be ideal for the country. Getting the full economic benefits of the 2015 agreement is important for Iran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Borre also spoke about the urgency to find a solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Three months have passed, and we need to speed up our work.

sentences.sentence: The 2015 agreement was struck between Iran, the US, the EU and other world powers to curb Tehran's nuclear activities in return for relief from economic sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It remains unclear whether the indirect talks will lead to a deal, with both sides having differences on issues concerning sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: People gathered to lay flowers and pride flags, where a tragic shooting took place on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Around 1 a.m. that morning, a gunman opened fire in three locations in Norway's capital, including an LGBTQ plus nightclub, killing two people and injuring 21 more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The event took place hours before Oslo's pride parade was meant to begin, and it devastated the city's LGBTQ plus community. The country's crown prince was one of the mourners at the site, and he told reporters, it is important that we defend who we are, that Norway is a country where people are allowed to love who they want and be with who they want.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That was meant to be marked today, but it was not like that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We saw it for ourselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So it is important that we stand up for our rights and our values." Oslo's pride parade was postponed after the shooting, which authorities called an Islamist terror act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, they added that it is too early to determine if the shooter specifically targeted the LGBTQ plus community.

sentences.sentence: Warsaw hosted the biggest pride parade in central Europe on Sunday in a country that is run by an anti-LGBTQ plus government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This year it was joined by Ukraine's Pride Parade that would normally have been held in Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Warsaw we allow ourselves to walk around holding hands and there's less and less judgment as time goes by.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The ruling party despises us as much as they can so we have to fend for ourselves.

sentences.sentence: Bosnia's capital Sarajevo hosted only its third Pride March, with a special emphasis on bringing families with LGBTQ plus relatives closer together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A new museum tells a story of generations of refugees housed in Denmark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The museum float, which means escape in Danish, was built on the country's largest refugee camp, where 35,000 German refugees lived after World War II. And it is meant to depict their lives, in addition to the lives of other refugees, such as those fleeing Lebanon, Hungary and Vietnam.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: When you hear about refugees throughout the world today, you hear about huge numbers, faceless numbers, all sometimes frightening high numbers of people coming to your country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But we want to tell the story that behind these numbers, there are actual persons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Denmark has a large immigrant population, with more than 650,000 immigrants currently living in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But in recent years, it has made moves to restrict the number of people who are able to settle in Denmark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In 2016, it passed a new law that allowed it to seize assets from refugees to pay for their housing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Their first gig was in the Marquee in London in 1962. Now for their anniversary tour, the Rolling Stones return to the UK capital to perform at Hyde Park, with performer Mick Jagger stealing the show.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Appropriately, 60,000 fans gathered for the 60 year celebration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Beside Jagger featured guitarist Keith Richards and Ronnie Wood, who showed no sign of age, dancing and jumping around the stage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The group were also joined by Steve Jordan on the drums, following the death of drummer Charlie Watts who died aged 80 last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Rolling Stones treated the crowd to all the classics, opening with Street Fighting Man and 19th Nervous Breakdown. The concert was Jagger's first outing on stage after the singer contracted Covid-19, forcing the group to cancel gigs in Amsterdam and Bern at short notice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They have been rescheduled for later dates in July.
